an3.55:4.1: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha,
an3.55:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an3.55:4.4: “Master Gotama, they say that ‘extinguishment is realizable in this very life’.
an3.55:4.5: In what way is extinguishment realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves?”
an3.55:5.1: “A greedy person, overcome by greed, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.55:5.2: When greed has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.55:5.3: This is how extinguishment is realizable in this very life.
an3.55:6.2: A deluded person, overcome by delusion, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.55:6.3: When delusion has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.55:6.4: This, too, is how extinguishment is realizable in this very life.
an3.55:7.1: When you experience the ending of greed, hate, and delusion without anything left over,
an3.55:7.2: that’s how extinguishment is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”
an3.55:8.2: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
